title: close
extract: "Close" (noun pronounced to rhyme with adjectival form of "close"), a British term for alley or cul-de-sac. "Close", an ecclesiastical term for lawn next to a cathedral or convent. "Close", old English term for an estate.
extract_html: "Close" (noun pronounced to rhyme with adjectival form of "close"), a British term for alley or cul-de-sac. "Close", an ecclesiastical term for lawn next to a cathedral or convent. "Close", old English term for an estate.
